newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippines raises three-month special T-bill rate.
newsitem.headline: Philippines raises three-month special T-bill rate.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Wednesday it had raised its three-month special series Treasury bill rate to 9.75 percent from 9.5 percent.
The adjustment came two days after the benchmark 91-day T-bill rate inched up to 10.107 percent from 9.583 percent during its weekly auction.
The Central bank also said it had withdrawn its 330-day special series T-bills, which carried a 10.3 percent coupon, from its over-the-counter facility.
The bank kept its overnight and termed reverse repo rates unchanged.
